item.title: Meghan Trainor pulls video altered to make her thinner
item.description: Singer Meghan Trainor had her new music video "Me Too" taken down Monday because her waist was altered to look smaller.
item.ExtractedText: Actress Tia Mowry said in December that she has been the subject of negative comments on Instagram since gaining weight. Questions about whether she is pregnant amount to body-shaming, she said. Hide Caption 6 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Gigi Hadid is not letting negative comments about her appearance get to her. The model, center, posted an open letter on social media to trolls, saying, "Your mean comments don't make me want to change my body." Hide Caption 7 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Designer, author and former star of "The Hills" Lauren Conrad announced that her website will no longer use terminology associated with body-shaming. Hide Caption 8 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Actress Lily James was the subject of some negative chatter after photos surfaced of her as a wasp-waisted Cinderella in early 2015. The actress said she is naturally small, and "I'm so healthy." Hide Caption 9 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed In 2013, one critic called actress Melissa McCarthy a "female hippo" in a review of her film "Identity Thief." "We have to stop categorizing and judging women based on their bodies," McCarthy wrote in a recent Instagram post. Hide Caption 10 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Singer Kelly Clarkson has seen her weight fluctuate over the years. The Internet had a great deal to say after she didn't immediately shed the weight after the birth of her daughter in 2014. "I don't obsess about my weight, which is probably one of the reasons why other people have such a problem with it," she told Redbook in May. Hide Caption 11 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed In 2014, actress Emma Stone told USA Today , "I've seen a lot of comments that say, 'Eat a sandwich' or 'She looks sick.' I've been looking at myself in the mirror being mean to myself. I'm not sick. I eat sandwiches." Hide Caption 12 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Actress Jennifer Lawrence has been accused of being overweight and in 2013 told Barbara Walters, "I just think it should be illegal to call somebody fat on TV." Hide Caption 13 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Cracks about Kerry Washington being too thin have hit the "Scandal" star, as People reported that she told Essence in 2007 that she has struggled with eating disorders. "I used food as a way to cope. There was a lot of guilt and a lot of shame." Hide Caption 14 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Nicole Richie went from Paris Hilton's thicker sidekick to a very thin fashionista. In 2006, she told Vanity Fair , "I know I'm too thin right now, so I wouldn't want any young girl looking at me and saying, 'That's what I want to look like.' " Hide Caption 15 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed E!'s Giuliana Rancic told People that a cancer-suppressing drug she has to take after a double mastectomy in 2011 is responsible for her small frame. "I'm sorry that some people think I'm disgustingly skinny, as they put it, but there's nothing I can do. I'm lucky that I even have the type of cancer that reacts to the medicine," she said. Hide Caption 16 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Singer and actress Jessica Simpson seems to alternate between being accused of being too big and too small. Hide Caption 17 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Most women would kill to look like model Kate Upton, but one blogger wrote that the Sports Illustrated cover girl has "Huge thighs, NO waist, big fat floppy boobs, terrible body definition -- she looks like a squishy brick." Hide Caption 18 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed After "Fast & Furious" actress Gal Gadot was cast as Wonder Woman in "Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice," the Internet immediately started buzzing that she was too skinny for the role. The actress reportedly responded , "I represent the Wonder Women of the new world." Hide Caption 19 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Women aren't the only ones body-shamed. After friends encouraged actor Val Kilmer to post a photo of his weight loss, he took to Facebook to say, "Can't win in this crazy town. Too heavy for too many years and now gossip says, too thin!" Hide Caption 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Actress Keira Knightley once told Elle UK that she has been called "anorexic." Hide Caption In 2014, Cosmopolitan asked whether Gabourey Sidibe is "the Most Fat-Shamed Actress in Hollywood." Hide Caption 23 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Actress Rebel Wilson has gone a step beyond worrying about those who criticize her for her weight: She's found fame playing "Fat Amy" in the "Pitch Perfect" films. Hide Caption 24 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed In April 2015, actress Tara Reid tweeted to the media to "stop bullying" her about her weight, as she says she is a "skinny girl." Hide Caption 25 of 26 26 photos: Celebs who have been body-shamed Reality star Khloe Kardashian has endured harsh commentary, including being called the "fat Kardashian." These days, she's slimmed down and silenced critics. Hide Caption
